result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William G Johnson Jr

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:17 AM Defendant William G Johnson Jr in court.  Prosecuting attorney Diane M. Donohoo in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Deft has gone to the SPD's office but was found not eligible.
Deft has not brought in the Petition for a court appointed atty.
Deft indicates he left the paperwork at home.
BTC: Matter adjourned for deft to bring the paperwork.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible
State's Notice of Intent to introduce certified public records w/o extrinsic evidence

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

2:10 PM Prosecuting attorney Barry J Braatz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant William G Johnson Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Natalie Probst appeared by video for William G Johnson Jr. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
